canonical_explanation.text: A pattern is something that repeats again and again in the same order. We can see patterns all around us — in nature, on clothes, on floor tiles, and in beautiful designs. Stripes on a zebra, petals on a flower, and checks on a shirt are all patterns. When we look carefully, we can find patterns in our classroom, our home, and in festivals too.
rules: A pattern is something that repeats in the same order.
Animals like zebras and tigers have stripe patterns in nature.
Flowers have petal patterns — petals are arranged in a repeating way.
Clothes can have patterns like stripes, checks, dots, or flowers.
Floor tiles, wall tiles, and fences can show repeating patterns.
Rangoli and mehndi are examples of cultural patterns and designs.
To find a pattern, look for the part that repeats.
